name: celaront
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, w2))
-| wex(s0, w0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, w2))
-| wex(s0, w0)

comment: "Celaront", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic. No ` ph ` is ` ps ` , all ` ch ` is ` ph ` , and some ` ch ` exist, therefore some ` ch ` is not ` ps ` . Instance of ~ barbari . In Aristotelian notation, EAO-1: MeP and SaM therefore SoP. For example, given "No reptiles have fur", "All snakes are reptiles", and "Snakes exist", prove "Some snakes have no fur". Note the existence hypothesis. Example from ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syllogism . (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 27-Aug-2016.)
